intro: Aphora, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Aphora typically grows in open, sunny areas and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardeners looking to add vibrant color to their landscapes.
